operations.summary: Creates a widget and and returns the widgetId in the response to the client.
operations.notes: This is a primary endpoint which is used to create a new widget. You can create a widget in one of the 3 mentioned states: a) DRAFT - to incrementally build the widget, b) AUTHORING - to add/edit form fields in the widget, c) ACTIVE - to immediately host the widget. You can use the PUT /widgets/{widgetId}/state endpoint to transition a widget between the above mentioned states. An allowed transition would follow the any of the following sequences: DRAFT->AUTHORING->ACTIVE, ACTIVE<->INACTIVE, DRAFT->CANCELLED.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • widget_write
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.

parameters.name: x-api-user
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user
parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account

parameters.name: WidgetInfo
parameters.description: Information about the widget that you want to create.

errorResponses.reason: BAD_REQUEST: The request provided is invalid.
INVALID_ARGUMENTS: One or more arguments to the method are invalid.
INVALID_EMAIL: Email provided is invalid.
INVALID_FILE_INFO: Invalid or no file info is provided.
INVALID_JSON: An invalid JSON was specified.
INVALID_ORDER: Order of participant sets define an invalid range.
INVALID_PARTICIPANT_ROLE: Role provided is invalid.

INVALID_ACCESS_TOKEN: Access token provided is invalid or has expired.
INVALID_USER: Invalid user ID or email provided in x-user header.
NOT_AUTHORIZED_FOR_TRANSIENT_RESOURCE: Not authorized for the transient resource referred in the request.
NO_AUTHORIZATION_HEADER: Authorization header not provided.
UNAUTHORIZED: You cannot work on behalf of this user.
UNVERIFIED_USER: The user has registered but has not verified their email address. The user must use the Adobe Sign web site to complete verification.
API_TERMS_NOT_ACCEPTED: Your account is locked because an administrator has not agreed to Adobe Sign's Terms of Use. Please contact your account administrator to activate your account.

INVALID_ON_BEHALF_OF_USER: Invalid user ID or email provided in x-on-behalf-of-user header.
INVALID_USER: Invalid user ID or email provided in x-user header.
NOT_AUTHORIZED_FOR_TRANSIENT_RESOURCE: Not authorized for the transient resource referred in the request.
NO_AUTHORIZATION_HEADER: Authorization header not provided.
UNAUTHORIZED: You cannot work on behalf of this user.
UNVERIFIED_USER: The user has registered but has not verified their email address. The user must use the Adobe Sign web site to complete verification.
INVALID_DOCUMENT_ID: The Document ID specified is invalid.
INVALID_TRANSIENTDOCUMENT_ID: The Transient Document ID specified is invalid.
INVALID_WIDGET_ID: The Widget ID specified is invalid.
TRANSIENT_RESOURCE_DELETED: Transient Resource deleted from the server.
WIDGET_NOT_AVAILABLE: The widget document is not yet available or will have no pages to view.
WIDGET_NOT_MODIFIED: The widget has not been modified.
UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE: Content type was not provided or is not supported.
MISC_SERVER_ERROR: Some miscellaneous error has occurred.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • widget_write
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.

parameters.name: x-api-user
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user
parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account

parameters.name: widgetId
parameters.description: The widget identifier, as returned by the widget creation API or retrieved from the API to fetch widgets.

parameters.name: VisibilityInfo
parameters.description: Information to update visibility of widget

errorResponses.reason: BAD_REQUEST: The request provided is invalid.
INVALID_JSON: An invalid JSON was specified.
INVALID_X_API_USER_HEADER: Value provided in x-api-user header is in invalid format.
MISSING_REQUIRED_PARAM: Required parameters are missing.
INVALID_ACCESS_TOKEN: Access token provided is invalid or has expired.
INVALID_ON_BEHALF_OF_USER: Invalid user ID or email provided in x-on-behalf-of-user header.
NO_AUTHORIZATION_HEADER: Authorization header not provided.
PERMISSION_DENIED: The API caller does not have the permission to execute this operation.
INVALID_PARTICIPANT_ID: The participant ID specified is invalid.
INVALID_PARTICIPANT_SET_ID: The participant set ID specified is invalid.
INVALID_WIDGET_ID: The Widget ID specified is invalid.
WIDGET_NOT_AVAILABLE: The widget document is not yet available or will have no pages to view.
MISC_SERVER_ERROR: Some miscellaneous error has occurred.

operations.summary: Updates the state of a widget identified by widgetId in the path.
operations.notes: This endpoint can be used by creator of the widget to transition between the states of widget. An allowed transition would follow any of the following sequence :  DRAFT->AUTHORING->ACTIVE, ACTIVE<->INACTIVE, DRAFT->CANCELLED.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
An OAuth Access Token with scopes:
  • widget_write
in the format 'Bearer {accessToken}'.

parameters.name: x-api-user
parameters.description: The userId or email of API caller using the account or group token in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. If it is not specified, then the caller is inferred from the token.

parameters.name: x-on-behalf-of-user
parameters.description: The userId or email in the format userid:{userId} OR email:{email}. of the user that has shared his/her account

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: The server will only update the resource if it matches the listed ETag otherwise error RESOURCE_MODIFIED(412) is returned.

parameters.name: widgetId
parameters.description: The widget identifier, as returned by the widget creation API or retrieved from the API to fetch widgets.

errorResponses.reason: INVALID_ARGUMENTS: One or more arguments to the method are invalid.
INVALID_JSON: An invalid JSON was specified.
INVALID_ON_BEHALF_OF_USER_HEADER: Value provided in x-on-behalf-Of-user header is in invalid format.
INVALID_X_API_USER_HEADER: Value provided in x-api-user header is in invalid format.
MISSING_IF_MATCH_HEADER: If-Match header missing.
MISSING_REQUIRED_PARAM: Required parameters are missing.
INVALID_ACCESS_TOKEN: Access token provided is invalid or has expired.
INVALID_ON_BEHALF_OF_USER: Invalid user ID or email provided in x-on-behalf-of-user header.
INVALID_USER: Invalid user ID or email provided in x-user header.
NO_AUTHORIZATION_HEADER: Authorization header not provided.
KBA_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: KBA limit for identity verification is exhausted. Please select another method or contact your administrator.
PHONE_AUTH_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: Phone usage limit for identity verification is exhausted. Please select another method or contact your administrator.
SEND_LIMIT_EXCEEDED: Agreement creation quota of the user is exhausted.
INVALID_WIDGET_ID: The Widget ID specified is invalid.
RESOURCE_MODIFIED: Resource is already modified with newer version.
MISC_SERVER_ERROR: Some miscellaneous error has occurred.

additionalParticipantSetsInfo.description: List of all the participants in the widget except widget signer

authFailureInfo.description: URL and associated properties for the error page the widget signer will be taken after failing to authenticate

ccs.description: A list of one or more email addresses that you want to copy on this transaction. The email addresses will each receive an email when the final agreement created through widget is signed. The email addresses will also receive a copy of the document, attached as a PDF file

completionInfo.description: URL and associated properties for the success page the widget signer will be taken to after performing desired action on the widget

createdDate.description: Date when widget was created. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

creatorEmail.description: Email of widget creator. Only returned in GET response. Cannot be provided in POST/PUT request. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

fileInfos.description: A list of one or more files (or references to files) that will be used to create the widget. If more than one file is provided, they will be combined before the widget is created. Library documents are not permitted. Note: Only one of the four parameters in every FileInfo object must be specified

id.description: A resource identifier that can be used to uniquely identify the widget in other apis. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

locale.description: The locale associated with this widget - specifies the language for the signing page and emails, for example en_US or fr_FR. If none specified, defaults to the language configured for the widget creator

name.description: The name of the widget that will be used to identify it, in emails, website and other places

securityOption.description: Secondary security parameters for the widget

state.description: The state in which the widget should land. For example in order to create a widget in DRAFT state, field should be DRAFT. The state field will never get returned in GET /widgets/{ID} and will be ignored if provided in PUT /widgets/{ID} call. The eventual status of the widget can be obtained from GET /widgets/ID

status.description: Status of the Widget. If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

vaultingInfo.description: Vaulting properties that allows Adobe Sign to securely store documents with a vault provider

widgetParticipantSetInfo.description: Represents widget participant for whom email should not be provided

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant - specific data (email, e.g.). All participants in the array belong to the same set. Currently we are supporting only one member in the set. Since the email of the widget signer is unknown at the time of widget creation, the email should be left empty and its optional security options should be provided.

order.description: Index indicating position at which signing group needs to sign. Additional participant to sign at first place is assigned a index of 1. Widget participant should not have any order specified. Widget participant should not have any email address and and can not have phone authentication applied. Different signingOrder specified in input should form a valid consecutive increasing sequence of integers. Otherwise signingOrder will be considered invalid

role.description: Role assumed by all participants in the set (signer, approver, etc.) Widget First Participant will only have roles - Signer, Approver, Acceptor and Form Filler

email.description: Email of the particpant. In case of creating new Agreements(POST/PUT), this is a required field. In case of GET, this is the required field and will always be returned unless it is a fax workflow( legacy agreements) that were created using fax as input

securityOption.description: Security options that apply to the participant

authenticationMethod.description: The authentication method for the participants to have access to view and sign the document

password.description: The password required for the participant to view and sign the document. Note that AdobeSign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties. The password will not be returned in GET call. In case of PUT call, password associated with Agreement resource will remain unchanged if no password is specified but authentication method is provided as PASSWORD

phoneInfo.description: The phoneInfo required for the participant to view and sign the document

countryCode.description: The phone Info country code required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication method is PHONE

phone.description: The phone number required for the participant to view and sign the document if authentication method is PHONE

deframe.description:
If deframe is false, the resultant page will be shown inside the widget frame. If deframe is true, the resultant page will be shown in the full browser window. 
 Note that in the case of embedded widgets, browser security restrictions do not permit automatic redirection in the full browser window, so if deframe is true the user will instead just see a link to the success page. We recommend this scenario be avoided - in other words, setting deframe to false is recommended for embedded widgets

delay.description:
The delay (in seconds) before the user is taken to the resultant page. If this value is greater than 0, the user will first see the standard Adobe Sign result message, and then after a delay will be redirected to your resultant page. 
 Note that this parameter has no effect for embedded widgets when deframe is true

url.description:
A publicly accessible url to which the user will be sent after successfully completing the widget. 
If the URL you provide includes information that allows you to identify the specific transaction, such as your own unique identifier, you can use the browser request to this URL as a callback to notify you that this transaction is completed. 
In addition, Adobe Sign will append a documentKey parameter to the URL which will contain the Adobe Sign DocumentKey for this signed widget, but only if the sender is the same as the API key user. Your application can use this value to get the form data for this widget

email.description: Email of the CC participant of the widget

document.description: A document that is associated with the widget. This field cannot be provided in POST call. In case of GET call, this is the only field returned in the response

label.description: The unique label value of a file info element. In case of custom workflow this will map a file to corresponding file element in workflow definition. This must be specified in case of custom workflow agreement creation request

libraryDocumentId.description: ID for an existing Library document that will be added to the agreement

transientDocumentId.description: ID for a transient document that will be added to the agreement

urlFileInfo.description: URL for an external document to add to the agreement

id.description: ID of the document. In case of PUT call, this is the only field that is accepted in Document structure. Name and mimeType are ignored in case of PUT call

mimeType.description: mimeType of the original file. This is returned in GET but not accepted back in PUT

name.description: Name of the original document uploaded. This is returned in GET but not accepted back in PUT

numPages.description: Number of pages in the document

mimeType.description: The mime type of the referenced file, used to determine if the file can be accepted and the necessary conversion steps can be performed

name.description: The original system file name of the document being sent

url.description: A publicly accessible URL for retrieving the raw file content

openPassword.description: The secondary password that will be used to secure the PDF document. Note that AdobeSign will never show this password to anyone, so you will need to separately communicate it to any relevant parties

enabled.description: For accounts set up for document vaulting and the option to enable per agreement, this determines whether the document is to be vaulted

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant - specific data (email, e.g.). All participants in the array belong to the same set. Currently we are supporting only one member in the set. Since the email of the widget signer is unknown at the time of widget creation, the email should be left empty and its optional security options should be provided.

role.description: Role assumed by all participants in the set (signer, approver, etc.) Widget First Participant will only have roles - Signer, Approver, Acceptor and Form Filler

WidgetCreationResponse.description: A JSON object describing the widget

id.description: The unique identifier of widget which can be used to retrieve the data entered by the signers.

commonViewConfiguration.description: Common view configuration for all the available views

name.description: Name of the requested widget view

autoLoginUser.description: Auto LogIn Flag. If true, the URL returned will automatically log the user in. If false, the URL returned will require the credentials. By default its value is false

noChrome.description: No Chrome Flag. If true, the embedded page is shown without a navigation header or footer. If false, the standard page header and footer will be present. By default its value is false

embeddedCode.description: Embedded code of url of resource

isCurrent.description: True if this view is the current view

name.description: Name of the requested widget view

page.description: Pagination information for navigating through the response

nextCursor.description: Used to navigate to the next page. If notreturned, there are no further pages.

id.description: The unique identifier of a widget

hidden.description: True if agreement is hidden for the user

javascript.description: The embedded javascript code of the widget

modifiedDate.description: The date on which the widget was last modified. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

status.description: The widget status (AUTHORING, ACTIVE, DRAFT, DISABLED)

url.description: The hosted url of the widget

page.description: Pagination information for navigating through the response

displayDate.description: The display date for the agreement. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

displayParticipantSetInfos.description: The most relevant current user set for the agreement. It is typically the next signer if the agreement is from the current user, or the sender if received from another user

id.description: The unique identifier of the agreement.If provided in POST, it will simply be ignored

esign.description: True if this is an e-sign document

hidden.description: True if agreement is hidden for the user

latestVersionId.description: A version ID which uniquely identifies the current version of the agreement

status.description: The current status of the document from the perspective of the originator

displayUserSetMemberInfos.description: Displays the info about user set

company.description: Displays the name of the company of the user, if available

email.description: Displays the email of the user

fullName.description: Displays the full name of the user, if available.

actingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that created the event

actingUserIpAddress.description: The IP address of the user that created the event

actingUserName.description: The name of the acting user

comment.description: The event comment. For RECALLED or REJECTED, the reason given by the user that initiates the event. For DELEGATE or SHARE, the message from the acting user to the participant

date.description: The date of the audit event. Format would be yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ. For example, e.g 2016-02-25T18:46:19Z represents UTC time

description.description: A description of the audit event

deviceLocation.description: Location of the device that generated the event (This value may be null due to limited privileges)

devicePhoneNumber.description: Phone number from the device used when the participation is completed on a mobile phone

digitalSignatureInfo.description: This is present for ESIGNED events when the participation is signed digitally

initiatingUserEmail.description: Email address of the user that initiated the event on behalf of the acting user when the account is shared. Will be empty if there is no account sharing in effect

initiatingUserName.description: Full name of the user that initiated the event on behalf of the acting user when the account is shared. Will be empty if there is no account sharing in effect

participantEmail.description: Email address of the user that is the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant for the event. This may be different than the acting user for certain event types. For example, for a DELEGATION event, this is the user who was delegated to

participantRole.description: Role assumed by all participants in the participant set the participant belongs to (signer, approver etc.).

synchronizationId.description: A unique identifier linking offline events to synchronization events (specified for offline signing events and synchronization events, else null)

vaultEventId.description: The identifier assigned by the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

vaultProviderName.description: Name of the vault provider for the vault event (if vaulted, otherwise null)

versionId.description: An ID which uniquely identifies the version of the document associated with this audit event

company.description: Company name captured during digital signing

additionalParticipantSets.description: Information about the widget additional participant Sets

ccsInfo.description: Information of CC participants of the widget.

creatorInfo.description: Information of the creator of the widget.

sharesInfo.description: Information of the participants with whom the widget has been shared.

widgetParticipantSet.description: Information about the widget participant Set

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant set. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

memberInfos.description: Array of ParticipantInfo objects, containing participant-specific data (e.g. email). All participants in the array belong to the same set

order.description: Index indicating sequential signing group (specified for hybrid routing). This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

role.description: Role assumed by all participants in the set (signer, approver etc.). This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

company.description: The company of the participant, if available. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

email.description: Email of the participant. In case of modifying a participant set (PUT) this is a required field. In case of GET, this is the required field and will always be returned unless it is a fax workflow (legacy agreements) that were created using fax as input

fax.description: Fax of the participant. New Agreements can not be created with fax option. This is only returned for legacy agreements created with fax as participants

id.description: The unique identifier of the participant. This will be returned as part of Get call but is not mandatory to be passed as part of PUT call for agreements/{id}/members/participantSets/{id}.

name.description: The name of the participant, if available. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

privateMessage.description: The private message of the participant, if available. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

securityOption.description: Security options that apply to the participant. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call

self.description: True if this participant is the same user that is calling the API. Returned as part of Get. Ignored (not required) if modifying a participant set (PUT).

status.description: The status of the participant. This cannot be changed as part of the PUT call.

company.description: Company of the CC participant, if available.

email.description: Email of the CC participant of the widget

name.description: Name of the CC participant, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the CC participant of the widget.

company.description: Company of the creator, if available.

email.description: Email of the creator of the widget.

name.description: Name of the creator, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the creator of the widget.

self.description: True if the creator of the widget is the same user that is calling the API.

company.description: Company of the sharee participant of the widget, if available.

email.description: Email of the sharee participant of the widget.

name.description: Name of the sharee participant of the widget, if available.

participantId.description: The unique identifier of the sharee participant of the widget.

sharerParticipantId.description: The unique identifier of the participant who shared the widget.

visibility.description: Specifies the visibility. The possible values are HIDE or SHOW

widgetInActiveInfo.description: Specify custom message which will be displayed  to the user or the URL to which user will be redirected when the widget is accessed in disabled state. This can be specified only in PUT request

message.description: Display this custom message to the user when the widget is accessed. Note that this can contain wiki markup to include clickable links in the message. This is required if redirectUrl is not provided. Both message and redirectUrl can not be specified.

redirectUrl.description: Redirect the user to this URL when the widget is accessed. This is required if message is not provided. Both message and redirectUrl can not be specified.
